metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4055 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
When the number of cookies per domain was exceeded in `document.cookie`,the actual cookie jar sent to the host was no longer consistent withexpected cookie jar state. This could have caused requests to be sent withsome cookies missing. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 116, Firefox ESR< 102.14, and Firefox ESR < 115.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4055` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.15.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
